Line 238: Line 238:
On May 5, 2011, Trump announced he would not be the celebrity pace-car driver for the 2011 [[Indianapolis 500|Indy 500]] as was previously announced a month earlier by the [[Indianapolis Motor Speedway]] (on April 5, 2011.)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/motor/indycar/2011-05-05-trump-indy500_N.htm|title=Donald Trump bows out of Indy 500; won't drive pace car|author=Curt Cavin|coauthor=Dan McFeely|work=Indianapolis Star|published by = USA Today|date=May 5, 2011|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indianapolismotorspeedway.com/default/news/show/42166-global-icon-trump-to-drive-100th-anniversary-indianapolis-500-pace-car/|title=Global Icon Trump To Drive 100th Anniversary Indianapolis 500 Pace Car|author=Paul Kelly|work=Indianapolis Motor Speedway|date=April 5, 2011|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref> Trump stated he made the decision because of business constraints, but there had been a fan campaign for the Speedway to instead name a racing celebrity to the position<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indystar.com/article/20110504/ENTERTAINMENT/105040329/Campaign-grows-set-early-bump-day-Trump?odyssey=tab|topnews|text|Sports|title=Campaign grows to set early bump day for Trump|author=Dan McFeely|work=Indianapolis Star|date= May 4, 2011|accessdate= May 11, 2011}}</ref> and a Speedway press release stated that Trump cancelled because of his intention to run for President.<ref>{{cite news|author=Weir, Tom|title=Donald Trump bows out of Indy 500 pace car role|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/gameon/post/2011/05/donald-trump-bows-out-of-indy-500-pace-car-role/1|date=May 5, 2011|work=USA Today|publisher=Gannett|accessdate=May 7, 2011}}</ref>
On May 5, 2011, Trump announced he would not be the celebrity pace-car driver for the 2011 [[Indianapolis 500|Indy 500]] as was previously announced a month earlier by the [[Indianapolis Motor Speedway]] (on April 5, 2011.)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/motor/indycar/2011-05-05-trump-indy500_N.htm|title=Donald Trump bows out of Indy 500; won't drive pace car|author=Curt Cavin|coauthor=Dan McFeely|work=Indianapolis Star|published by = USA Today|date=May 5, 2011|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indianapolismotorspeedway.com/default/news/show/42166-global-icon-trump-to-drive-100th-anniversary-indianapolis-500-pace-car/|title=Global Icon Trump To Drive 100th Anniversary Indianapolis 500 Pace Car|author=Paul Kelly|work=Indianapolis Motor Speedway|date=April 5, 2011|accessdate=May 11, 2011}}</ref> Trump stated he made the decision because of business constraints, but there had been a fan campaign for the Speedway to instead name a racing celebrity to the position<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indystar.com/article/20110504/ENTERTAINMENT/105040329/Campaign-grows-set-early-bump-day-Trump?odyssey=tab|topnews|text|Sports|title=Campaign grows to set early bump day for Trump|author=Dan McFeely|work=Indianapolis Star|date= May 4, 2011|accessdate= May 11, 2011}}</ref> and a Speedway press release stated that Trump cancelled because of his intention to run for President.<ref>{{cite news|author=Weir, Tom|title=Donald Trump bows out of Indy 500 pace car role|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/gameon/post/2011/05/donald-trump-bows-out-of-indy-500-pace-car-role/1|date=May 5, 2011|work=USA Today|publisher=Gannett|accessdate=May 7, 2011}}</ref>
â
===Statements regarding Barack Obama===
+
====Statements regarding Barack Obama====
Speaking to an audience in Boca Raton, Florida on April 16, 2011, Trump contended that voter reaction to former U.S. President [[George W. Bush]]'s performance was the cause for the election of his successor [[Barack Obama]], and further that Obama would probably be known as the worst president in U.S. history.<ref>[http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/april/233988/Donald-Trump:-Obama-will-go-down-as-worst-president-in-U.S.-history Donald Trump: Obama will go down as worst president in U.S. history].''Bright House Networks''. Retrieved April 17, 2011.</ref>
Speaking to an audience in Boca Raton, Florida on April 16, 2011, Trump contended that voter reaction to former U.S. President [[George W. Bush]]'s performance was the cause for the election of his successor [[Barack Obama]], and further that Obama would probably be known as the worst president in U.S. history.<ref>[http://www.cfnews13.com/article/news/2011/april/233988/Donald-Trump:-Obama-will-go-down-as-worst-president-in-U.S.-history Donald Trump: Obama will go down as worst president in U.S. history].''Bright House Networks''. Retrieved April 17, 2011.</ref>
